intro: Haastia sinclairii var. sinclairii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a striking plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asphodelaceae family and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and long, narrow leaves. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in coastal and sandy environments due to its salt tolerance. Its flowers, which are typically yellow or orange, appear in clusters at the top of the plant. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical significance in Māori culture.
